meanings.definition: A term of endearment for a young girl or woman.
meanings.sent1: My popsie always brings a smile to my face.
meanings.sent2: She is such a lovely popsie, always kind to everyone.
meanings.sent3: The popsie at the bakery greeted everyone with a warm smile.
meanings.sent4: Her popsie nature lit up the room like a ray of sunshine.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the popsie who helped me when I was lost.

meanings.definition: A sweet or attractive person, especially a woman.
meanings.sent1: She looked like a popsie in her beautiful dress.
meanings.sent2: The popsie at the party caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The popsie's sweet smile melted everyone's heart.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was as sweet as a popsie on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The popsie's charm was as irresistible as a candy store.

meanings.sent1: He was known as the popsie of the group, always charming the ladies.
meanings.sent2: The popsie's playful wink caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent3: The popsie's smooth talk always got him out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: Her popsie ways made her the life of the party.
meanings.sent5: The popsie's charisma was like a magnet, drawing everyone towards him.
